title:
Discovery of Raman-Scattered C II Lines in V366 Carinae with
  GHOST/Gemini South
abstract:
We report the detection of Raman-scattered C II lines at 7023 and 7054\r{A}
in the symbiotic star V366 Carinae using GHOST at Gemini South. These faint
features, originating from the C II doublet at ${\lambda}{\lambda}$ 1036 and
1037\r{A}, are rare and have been detected in only two other symbiotic stars:
V1016 Cygni and RR Telescopii. Our findings showcase the exceptional
sensitivity of GHOST to detect subtle spectral features and open the door to
comparative studies of Raman-scattered C II features across these systems.
